item.title: Everything I Know About Machine Learning I Learned from Making Soup
item.author: bgstieber@gmail.com (Brad Stieber)
item.description: Introduction In this post, I‚Äôm going to make the claim that we can simplify some parts of the machine learning process by using the analogy of making soup. I think this analogy can improve how a data scientist explains machine learning to a broad audience, and it provides a helpful framework throughout the model building process. Relying on some insight from the CRISP-DM framework, my own experience as an amateur chef, and the well-known iris data set, I‚Äôm going to explain why I think that the soup making and machine learning connection is a pretty decent first approximation you could use to understand the machine learning process.

item.title: An Introduction to the kmeans Algorithm
item.author: bgstieber@gmail.com (Brad Stieber)
item.description: This post will provide an R code-heavy, math-light introduction to selecting the \(k\) in k means. It presents the main idea of kmeans, demonstrates how to fit a kmeans in R, provides some components of the kmeans fit, and displays some methods for selecting k. In addition, the post provides some helpful functions which may make fitting kmeans a bit easier. kmeans clustering is an example of unsupervised learning, where we do not have an output we‚Äôre explicitly trying to predict.
